Data: Toss, 9am This is a surprise. Australia have won the toss and Shane Watson has decided to bowl. The pitch in St Vincent was so spinner and slow-ball friendly that batting first was the way to go. I wonder if this surface is different.
Lee to Charles, 1 wide the first ball is down leg side, Charles lets it pass. Lee's unhappy with that call because it may have clipped the thigh pad as the batsman let it go
Lee to Charles, no run this time the ball is wide outside off but isn't called, good pace and bounce off the pitch
Lee to Charles, no run Charles stays in his crease, gets behind the line and defends a good length ball towards point
Lee to Charles, no run defended on the off side

Lee to Charles, no run Lee roars a confident appeal for lbw but the umpire says not out. Australia decide not to review. Lee pitched in line and the ball went straight through to hit the pad. That was hitting high on middle and leg stump. Had Watson reviewed it, the umpire would have had to overturn his decision.
Lee to Charles, 2 runs played through the off side and Charles scores his first international runs at home
Lee to Charles, no run played off the back foot towards cover
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 wide he too starts with a wide down leg side
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run pitches on a good length around off and the ball jags away from the right-hander, Barath watches it closely and shoulders arms
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run the ball leaves the right-hander off the pitch once again, good carry through to Wade
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run played back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run played off the back foot towards the leg side
Hilfenhaus to Barath, FOUR runs width outside off stump and Barath stays in his crease and plays a flowing back-foot drive through cover, superbly timed
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run the ball pitches on a good length and seams and bounces sharply away from the right-hander, Barath gets squared up on the back foot and is beaten
Lee to Charles, no run Charles gets behind the line and defends on the leg side
Lee to Charles, no run full ball on middle stump, defended from the crease towards midwicket
Lee to Charles, no run Charles chases a wide ball outside off, throwing his bat at it, trying to blaze through cover. His footwork is poor and he gets beaten
Lee to Charles, no run good length and straight, Charles stays in his crease and blocks
Lee to Charles, 1 run Lee pitches on a good length around off and shapes the ball away from Charles, who stays in his crease and steers towards third man
Lee to Barath, 1 wide that's full and wide down leg side, Wade leaps and makes a one-handed save
Lee to Barath, no run full ball outside off stump, Charles strides forward and shoulders arms, once again the carry to Wade is good
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run Charles has a careless waft at a good length ball that leaves him from just outside off, he is beaten
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run Hilfenhaus pitches in line with the stumps and begins to seam the ball away, Charles defends
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run a loud appeal for lbw but the umpire says not out and Australia do not review. The ball was full and Charles missed the flick, but that was missing leg
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run defended towards point from the crease
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run played towards cover point
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run pushed from the crease towards midwicket
Lee to Barath, FOUR runs Barath goes after a ball that is on the fuller side outside off, he opens the face as he plays a powerful square drive and places it through point
Lee to Barath, FOUR runs full length on a straighter line, Barath stays in his crease and flicks through midwicket, mid-on chases but can't prevent the boundary

Lee to Barath, FOUR runs a third consecutive boundary! Barath drives again, he was aiming for cover but sliced it in the air between two men in the point region, he went hard at the ball so it raced to the boundary
Lee to Barath, no run a slower ball on a good length, Barath gets behind the line and blocks
Lee to Barath, 1 run played firmly towards square leg for a single
Lee to Charles, no run Charles stays in his crease and plays to cover
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run Barath jumps back and across to defend a length ball that pitches around middle and off and begins to move away from the right-hander
Hilfenhaus to Barath, FOUR runs short ball down leg side, Barath moves across and hooks, hitting the ball past Wade, just helping it along to the fine-leg boundary really
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run played crisply towards cover point, the ball is hitting the middle of Barath's bat, not so much for Charles
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 run Barath moves across and closes his bat's face to play the fuller ball towards square
Hilfenhaus to Charles, 1 run Charles stays in his crease and drives the ball towards mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 run played off the back foot towards cover, where Michael Hussey fumbles to allow a single. That ball went straight to Hussey, a rare mistake from him
Lee to Barath, no run good length and straight, defended towards the bowler
Lee to Barath, no run short of a length outside off stump, Barath chooses to let it go
Lee to Barath, FOUR runs full ball on leg and middle, Barath stays in his crease and hits it off his pads in the air but to mid-on's left, well timed again
Lee to Barath, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, Barath reaches out for the ball and carves it over the in field at point with a powerful cut
Lee to Barath, no run good length and quick outside off stump, bounced sharply as well, Barath pushes from his crease away from his body and is beaten
Lee to Barath, no run driven to mid-off from the crease
Hilfenhaus to Charles, 1 run Charles moves towards the line of the ball as it swerves away from him and steers towards third man
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 2 runs he's mis-timed this pull, it was not short enough and Barath ended up lobbing it over midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Barath, 1 wide that's bowled down leg side
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run good length and straight, Barath defends from his crease on the off side
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run played off the pads towards square leg
Hilfenhaus to Barath, no run good length on middle and off, Barath once again moves across and defends with a straight bat

Hilfenhaus to Barath, FOUR runs shot, Barath's simply lined up a full ball from Hilfenhaus and biffed it in the air past the bowler. The timing is splendid again. You can do that on this pitch, hit through the line. Barath plonked his foot forward and swung hard
McKay to Charles, no run good length on off stump, Charles stays in his crease and defends to point
McKay to Charles, no run Charles drives at the ball, trying to hit down the ground. He gets beaten. No where near as fluent as Barath, in terms of timing.
McKay to Charles, no run played off the back foot towards point again
McKay to Charles, 1 run Charles throws his bat off the front foot at a length ball outside off, he was aiming for cover but edged it towards third man, reached the fielder on the first bounce

McKay to Barath, FOUR runs Barath shows how it's done! He moves forward and towards the off, to get closer to the length ball, and simply drives through the line, hitting the ball in the air over cover
McKay to Barath, no run good length but wider outside off, Barath lets it go
Hilfenhaus to Charles, 1 wide a full ball down leg side, there have been a few such wides today
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run short of a length around off stump, defended on the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run Charles pushes from his crease and drives a length ball to mid-on
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run good length on middle and off, Charles stays in his crease and plays the ball back to McKay
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run good length and straight, played towards square leg
Hilfenhaus to Charles, no run Charles tries to play towards the leg side but misses and is hit on the back leg, that was missing leg stump so no appeal from the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Charles, FOUR runs Charles finally finds the gap and times the cover drive well. There was width outside off and he went hard at the ball, driving away from his body

McKay to Barath, OUT caught behind! McKay, like he so often does, has picked up the wicket. The ball pitched on a good length just outside off and seamed away from the right-hander. It bounced a bit more as well. Barath stayed in his crease and prodded away from his body, getting a thick edge to Wade
McKay to Samuels, no run Samuels moves back and across and shoulders arms to a good length ball outside off stump
McKay to Samuels, no run fuller length outside off, Samuels drives from his crease towards mid-off
McKay to Samuels, no run good length outside off stump, left alone by the batsman
McKay to Samuels, no run short of a length outside off, Samuels watches it go past again
McKay to Samuels, 1 wide that's wide outside off stump, Samuels goes after it with a flamboyant front-foot cover drive, reaching far away from his body, he makes no contact
McKay to Samuels, no run good length just outside off stump, Samuels plays off the back foot inside the line of the ball and gets beaten
Watson to Charles, 1 run length ball angling into the right-hander, played off the pads towards square leg
Watson to Samuels, no run a full ball around middle stump, Samuels pushes from his crease towards mid-on, a similar ball trapped him lbw in the previous game, but that was on a slower pitch
Watson to Samuels, no run defended from the crease towards the bowler
Watson to Samuels, no run played off the front foot towards cover
Watson to Samuels, no run length ball on the pads, played towards square leg
Watson to Samuels, no run Samuels moves across and defends towards point
McKay to Charles, 1 run Charles takes a small step forward and drives the ball towards wide mid-on
McKay to Samuels, no run good length with good bounce outside off stump, the batsman shoulders arms
McKay to Samuels, 1 run good length outside off, Samuels chooses to play back and open the face to steer towards third man
McKay to Charles, no run pushed off the front foot towards cover
McKay to Charles, no run Charles drives at the ball from his crease and mid-times it towards cover, not very pretty, that shot
McKay to Charles, no run defended from the crease towards midwicket
Watson to Samuels, no run driven off the front foot but to the bowler
Watson to Samuels, no run pushed off the front foot towards point, Watson is keeping his regular wicket-to-wicket line
Watson to Samuels, FOUR runs a half-volley outside off stump and Samuels uses the width to square drive through the gap at point, he came forward to play that shot
Watson to Samuels, 1 run the ball rises from a good length and Samuels takes one hand off the bat while steering to third man
Watson to Charles, no run good length with bounce and a little seam away from the right-hander, Charles stays in his crease and hangs his bat outside off stump, he is beaten
Watson to Charles, no run good length on off stump, played back to the bowler
McKay to Samuels, no run good length angling into Samuels who stays in his crease and defends on the leg side
McKay to Samuels, no run driven from the crease with poor timing to cover
McKay to Samuels, no run wider outside off stump, the batsman gets drawn out into driving to cover
McKay to Samuels, no run good length outside off, Samuels defends from his crease on the off side
McKay to Samuels, 1 run played off the back foot towards third man, the length was shorter outside off
McKay to Charles, 1 run short of a length outside off, played off the back foot in front of point for a single
Watson to Charles, 2 runs full ball on the pads, flicked towards deep backward square leg

Watson to Charles, no run a huge appeal once again for lbw, and again Watson decides not to review the not-out decision. Charles was only a little forward and was hit high on the pad. Replays indicate the ball would have clipped the top of leg stump, but it wuld have stayed with the on-field call of not out
Watson to Charles, no run this time there was an inside edge on to the pad as Charles closed the face, Watson cut short his appeal

Watson to Charles, 1 run Charles tries to drive powerfully through the off side but ends up slashing the ball towards third man, the ball is about to go for a one-bounce four but Mckay slides along the boundary and saves runs
Watson to Samuels, no run defended on the leg side
Watson to Samuels, no run played from the crease towards point
McKay to Charles, no run defended back to the bowler from the crease
McKay to Charles, no run driven on the front foot towards mid-off
McKay to Charles, no run defended on the off side from the crease

McKay to Charles, SIX runs so he can time the ball well then. Charles moves forward, gets under a length delivery and lofts through the line, hitting the ball cleanly over the bowler's head. Lovely shot
McKay to Charles, 1 run played from the crease in front of point
McKay to Samuels, no run Samuels gets beaten by a good length ball that bounces a bit more outside off
Watson to Charles, no run on a length, outside off stump, squeezed away square on the drive
Watson to Charles, no run length ball, on the stumps and Charles pats the ball into the leg side
Watson to Charles, 1 run pitched up a little more and driven through a gap at cover to the sweeper on the boundary
Watson to Samuels, no run full length, Samuels steps out and drives to mid-off - the batsmen think about a run but change their minds
Watson to Samuels, 1 run back of a length, bouncing into the body, flicked round the corner for one
Watson to Charles, no run width outside off but Charles's flowing cut shot finds the man at point
McKay to Samuels, no run on a length, seaming just a touch away, Samuels plays back, guiding the ball to short third man
McKay to Samuels, no run pitched up but taking the pace off it, driven on the full to cover
McKay to Samuels, no run probing line on or around off from McKay - Samuels leans forward to defend
McKay to Samuels, no run touch short, gets a bit of bounce off the surface, the ball deflecting off Samuels glove and between his legs
McKay to Samuels, no run length, drawing the batsman out, beating the outside edge
McKay to Samuels, no run length ball outside off and Samuels shuffles across to leave this time - that's a maiden from McKay
Watson to Charles, 1 leg bye length, on the stumps, tickled towards midwicket
Watson to Samuels, no run pitched up and driven hard square - but David Warner shows his agility with a diving stop at point
Watson to Samuels, no run tad shorter, the balls rears and Samuels block on front of his stumps
Watson to Samuels, 1 run pitched up on the legs and clipped out to deep square this time
Watson to Charles, no run slightly back of a length, Charles stays back and is beaten outside off as he fished from the crease
Watson to Charles, no run fuller ball, driven to cover
Lee to Samuels, no run good length, outside off, played square into the off side from the crease
Lee to Samuels, 2 runs slightly fuller and Samuels leans out to push the ball behind point - plenty of time for them to run a couple as long leg comes round
Lee to Samuels, no run length, outside off and driven to mid-off
Lee to Samuels, no run back of a length, Samuels moves across in front of his stumps and dabs to short third man
Lee to Samuels, no run pitched up, driven to mid-off - not the cleanest of connections from the batsman

Lee to Samuels, OUT the lights finally go out for Samuels! The watching world can sleep easy ... Lee fizzed one through, Samuels fenced and got the thinnest of nicks through to Wade. I can't see that disappointing the crowd too much - a scratchy innings has scratched its last
Doherty to Charles, 1 run flighted, on the stumps, nudged square on the leg side
Doherty to Bravo, no run tossed up outside off, spinning back as Bravo leaves - didn't quite turn enough but it brought gasps from the attendant Aussies
Doherty to Bravo, no run pushed across, defended on the front foot outside off
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run flighted across the left-hander again, driven to mid-off
Doherty to Charles, FOUR runs fullish and Charles steps out to sweep powerfully to the deep backward square boundary
Doherty to Charles, 2 runs tossed up on the stumps and Charles paddles this one even finer - though this time there's a man in place to rein it in
Lee to Bravo, no run quick bumper from Lee, rising sharply on the batsman, who does well to get on top of it
Lee to Bravo, no run pitches this one up, sliding across Bravo ... who shoulders arms as the ball whistles through to the keeper
Lee to Bravo, 1 run full, guided behind square on the off side
Lee to Charles, no run pitched up outside off, Charles stands and thumps cross-batted to mid-on, who dives to cut it off
Lee to Charles, FOUR runs just a little short from Lee and Charles seizes on it, whipping his arms through a pull shot that flies over midwicket and hard away to the boundary
Lee to Charles, 2 runs this time Charles swings through the off side - he's coming out of his shell. Lee doesn't look to pleased about it
Doherty to Bravo, 2 runs tad short from Doherty, Bravo cuts through a gap in the covers
Doherty to Bravo, no run tossed up, defended outside off stump
Doherty to Bravo, no run flatter, quicker, Bravo again plays a forward defensive on the stumps
Doherty to Bravo, no run flighted, knocked back to the bowler on the back foot
Doherty to Bravo, no run tossed up outside off and pushed to the man at extra-cover
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run flatter, again sliding across, cut away to the deep square boundary
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, 1 wide loses his line down the leg side - not the best start
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run slightly short, angled across, cut to point
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length, on the stumps, prodded short on the off side
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, FOUR runs almost a full toss, wide of off stumps and Bravo opens the face, guiding the ball off the toe of the bat down to third man
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run defended coming forward in front of the stumps
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length, on the stumps, defended square on the off side
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run line and length for Hilfenhaus, with Bravo sitting back to blocking to point
Doherty to Charles, no run on the stumps, flighted, straightening a touch, and defended

Doherty to Charles, OUT the St Lucia crowd falls silent: Charles has holed out to long-on. It was a length ball and Charles skipped out eagerly to meet it but his slog didn't quite come off the middle - the ball ending up in Brett Lee's middle as he took a jumping catch on the boundary

Doherty to Bravo, OUT Dwayne Bravo faces a review first ball ... and he's gone! Doherty tossed one up around leg stump, Bravo leaned forward with his bat against his pad. The ball thunked just below the knee roll - and replays showed it would have gone on to break the wicket. That's two in two for Doughy!
Doherty to Pollard, no run flat delivery, given a rip, but Pollard turns the hat-trick ball off his pads
Doherty to Pollard, no run flighted, outside off and just misses the outside edge as Pollard attempts to cut
Doherty to Pollard, no run defended in front of the stumps by the big man
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run drops slightly shot, Bravo plays the ball towards cover off the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length, on off and Bravo steps out to defend
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length, driven towards cover and again no run
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run shorter ball, played off the back foot out to point
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run angled across, around off stump, Bravo pushes square towards point again
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, FOUR runs pitched up and this time Bravo finds the gap, lacerating a drive to the backward point boundary
Doherty to Pollard, no run floated up around off, Pollard defends
Doherty to Pollard, no run length, on off, still no bite from Pollard, who defends back to the bowler
Doherty to Pollard, FOUR runs full, on the stumps and this time Pollard heaves the ball back down the ground - he hit that straight and hard to beat long-on
Doherty to Pollard, no run on off stump, Pollard plays back
Doherty to Pollard, no run on the stumps, defended coming forward
Doherty to Pollard, no run tossed up and clipped to midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run short, defended into the off side
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run back of a length, Bravo sits in his crease and defends towards point
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length ball, angled across, defended into the covers
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run nagging line and length, Bravo steps out and plays the ball square
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, 1 run drops short and Bravo rides the bounce, cutting hard past the dive of extra-cover
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, 1 wide Pollard ducks under a bumper - and it's called on height
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, 1 run length, on the stumps, nudged into the on side
Doherty to Pollard, FOUR runs again Pollard goes down the ground, picking Doherty up from around off stump and smacking him to straight-ish long-on
Doherty to Pollard, no run tossed up, defended on off stump
Doherty to Pollard, 2 runs flatter, width for Pollard, who slashes the ball away behind point
Doherty to Pollard, no run length, defended back to the bowler
Doherty to Pollard, no run full length, Pollard presses forward and blocks
Doherty to Pollard, no run drags the length back, slight turn, clipped back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length, angled outside off and dabbed to point
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, 1 run metronomic attack from Hilfenhaus - this time Bravo manages to flick him through gully for one
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run tight off-stump line, Pollard defends standing back in his crease
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, 2 runs slightly short and hooked, though off the splice - still went quite a long way towards deep midwicket
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, 2 runs pitched up on the pads and glanced to long leg, who makes a tumbling stop
Hilfenhaus to Pollard, no run bouncer and Pollard genuflects to let it pass over his head
Doherty to Bravo, FOUR runs flighted, from left to right, driven hard from outside off to the deep cover boundary
Doherty to Bravo, no run on the stumps, nudged into the leg side
Doherty to Bravo, no run tossed up, Bravo leans round his pad and dabs to midwicket
Doherty to Bravo, no run flighted, forward defensive from Bravo
Doherty to Bravo, no run drags it shorter, Bravo goes back and punches down the wicket
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run on the legs, worked round the corner
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run length, angled across, pushed towards cover
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run slightly fuller, Bravo steps forward and blocks
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run turned into the leg side off a good length
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run tight line, defended back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, no run immaculate line and length, Bravo gets solidly behind it
Hilfenhaus to Bravo, 1 run finally a bit of room outside off and Bravo cuts to the sweeper at backward point
Doherty to Bravo, 2 runs cut hard off the back foot towards deep point, where Forrest covers a lot of ground and slides to prevent the boundary
Doherty to Bravo, 1 run pushed off the front foot towards point
Doherty to Pollard, no run bowled flat and quicker from round the wicket, Pollard stays back and plays towards the bowler
Doherty to Pollard, no run defended on the front foot
Doherty to Pollard, no run Pollard steps out of his crease but isn't to the pitch of the ball and has to defend
Doherty to Pollard, SIX runs that's too short and Pollard has hammered it, going back in a flash to pull with power, he's hit it flat but so hard that it's carried over the boundary rope
Lee to Bravo, 1 run good length outside off stump, driven from the crease towards long off

Lee to Pollard, no run Pollard tries to turn the ball on the leg side but it bounces sharply from a good length and it lobs off the leading edge towards the off side, Pollard took one hand off the bat as he played that
Lee to Pollard, 1 run defended from the crease on the leg side
Lee to Bravo, no run Bravo pushes away from his body at a length ball that angles across him and punches towards short cover, the ball was hit in the air but fell just short of the fielder
Lee to Bravo, no run short of a length delivery angling across the left-hander, Bravo stays back and steers towards backward point
Lee to Bravo, no run good length and straight, Bravo defends on the off side
Watson to Pollard, no run Watson beats Pollard by pitching just short of a length and getting the ball to bounce and straighten off the pitch

Watson to Pollard, no run Watson appeals but the umpire says not out. Pollard stayed back and was hit on the top of the front pad by one that angled into him, possibly too high. Replays indicate the ball would have only just clipped the bails so that would have been an on-field call
Watson to Pollard, 1 run defended on the front foot

Watson to Bravo, OUT Bravo's been caught! He drove hard at a length ball angling across him, playing away from his body, trying to hit on the up and through the line. He ended up slicing it high in the air towards the edge of the circle at cover. There was a fielder steaming in from the deep but David Hussey ran back from the in-field
Watson to Pollard, no run defended on the front foot towards the bowler
Watson to Pollard, no run played from the crease towards the off side
Lee to Russell, no run Lee tests the batsman with the quick bouncer, Russell has to duck in a hurry
Lee to Russell, no run short of a length at the body, Russell stays in his crease and plays towards midwicket
Lee to Russell, no run good length and straight, Russell gets behind the line and defends
Lee to Russell, no run length delivery just outside off, played from the crease towards point
Lee to Russell, no run short ball that rises rapidly outside off stump, Russell fends at it, trying to steer to third man, but is beaten
Lee to Russell, 1 run driven from the crease towards mid-off, the shot is mis-timed and the fielder is on the edge of the circle, so a single is available
Watson to Russell, no run he was nearly bowled there, Russell backed away to cut a length ball outside off and was beaten close to off stump
Watson to Russell, 1 run pushed from the crease with an angled bat to play the ball to third man

Watson to Pollard, no run Pollard comes down the pitch but then gets hit in the mid-section by a short of a length ball, the ball goes on the off side and Pollard wants one, but the fielder at point is quick to charge in and prevent the single
Watson to Pollard, 1 run dropped at his feet for a risky single, Russell responds quickly and sprints towards the danger end, beating Watson's sprint, clean pick-up and dive to break the stumps
Watson to Russell, no run Russel swings at a good length ball out side off and is beaten
Watson to Russell, no run defended on the back foot towards the bowler, Watson is bowling an impeccable line and length

Lee to Pollard, 2 runs Pollard backs away and pulls the ball into the empty space between midwicket and deep midwicket, David Hussey ran back from the circle, sprinting towards the outfield, and dived full length to try and catch the ball as it dropped over his head, it was just out of reach
Lee to Pollard, 1 run played on the leg side for a single

Lee to Russell, FOUR runs he's carted that for four over point! Russell cleared his front foot out of the way towards leg side, and was facing the short ball outside off square on, he flayed his bat, freeing his powerful arms and using the width on offer, slashing the ball for a one-bounce four, that almost carried for six
Lee to Russell, 1 run played towards midwicket for a single
Lee to Pollard, 2 runs played off the hips through square leg
Lee to Pollard, 1 run short of a length delivery at the body, fended down towards square leg on the back foot
Watson to Pollard, 1 wide a rare mistake in line from Watson, this one is down leg side
Watson to Pollard, SIX runs Pollard has blasted the length ball from around off stump over the long-off boundary. He stood in his crease and simply hit through the line with immense power
Watson to Pollard, 1 run played from the crease towards point for a single
Watson to Russell, FOUR runs Russel stays in his crease, gets down low and opens the face of his bat to steer the full ball from outside off between backward point and short third man
Watson to Russell, 1 run and Russell gives the fielder at third man work to do by cutting a length ball
Watson to Pollard, FOUR runs Short of a length but it's on the pads, Pollard glances the ball firmly and beats the diving fielder at short fine leg. Watson's figures have been ruined.
Watson to Pollard, no run defended on the front foot. Watson has more than doubled the number of runs he's conceded
Doherty to Russell, FOUR runs Russell gets down on one knee and sweeps powerfully into the gap on the square leg boundary
Doherty to Russell, 2 runs played off the back foot and he's placed it behind point, the fielder has some chasing to do
Doherty to Russell, 1 run bowled quickly into the right-hander, dabbed off the pads towards square leg
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run driven firmly towards long-on
Doherty to Russell, no run a full toss and Russell will feel he missed out, he hit it back to the bowler
Doherty to Russell, 1 run pushed from the crease into the gap at cover
McKay to Russell, 1 run short of a length ball, the batsman stays back and swivels to pull the ball along the ground to deep square leg
McKay to Pollard, 1 run a full ball on the pads, flicked powerfully to the fielder at deep square leg
McKay to Russell, 1 run a slower short ball, Russell pulls but can't beat Doherty at short fine leg
McKay to Pollard, 1 run nearly in the blockhole, Pollard stays in his crease and forces the ball towards long-on
McKay to Russell, 1 leg bye dabbed off the back foot towards square leg
McKay to Pollard, 1 leg bye tries to flick a one that's nearly in the blockhole off his pads but doesn't make proper contact
Watson to Russell, FOUR runs that's not that short but Russell is waiting, ready to pull, he heaves it with tremendous power for a one-bounce for to deep midwicket

Watson to Russell, OUT caught at extra cover! Watson bowled a full ball outside off stump, Russell stayed in his crease and drove hard, he made good contact, hitting the ball well but in the air towards Bailey, who took the catch to his left
Watson to Sammy, 1 run drives his first ball towards long-off for a single
Watson to Pollard, 1 run a full ball outside off, nearly in the blockhole, Pollard reaches out and plays it towards backward point
Watson to Sammy, 1 run nudged off the back foot towards deep backward square
Watson to Pollard, 1 run a full ball swinging into the blockhole, driven towards long on for a single

McKay to Pollard, SIX runs that's been caught, and then dropped. Pollard hit the ball high in the air towards deep backward square, Forrest judged the catch superbly and caught it with his back foot a centimetre from the boundary rope. He then held the ball for a second or two before beginning to lose his balance and go over the rope.
McKay to Pollard, 1 run driven down the ground to long off
McKay to Sammy, 1 run played off the back foot towards third man

McKay to Pollard, SIX runs watch out in the stands beyond deep midwicket! McKay's back of the hand slower ball is too short and it sits up for Pollard, who wallops it flat over the boundary with a powerful pull
McKay to Pollard, 1 run driven with power to long on for a single
McKay to Sammy, 1 run driven to long of for another single
Doherty to Pollard, no run mis-timed back to the bowler, Pollard was trying to hit that a bit too hard
Doherty to Pollard, 2 runs driven on the front foot to long-on
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run Pollard's tried to whack that down the ground, Doherty bowls a fast and flat ball and induces a mis-hit on the off side
Doherty to Russell, 1 run fired into the blockhole, the batsman digs it out towards cover

Doherty to Pollard, FOUR runs Pollard gets to his half-century by whacking Doherty flat over his head, nearly went all the way too, bounced just inside the boundary. That's the first fifty for West Indies in the series
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run driven hard and straight once again but the fielder in the deep cuts it off
McKay to Pollard, FOUR runs Pollard backs away towards leg and uses the room he's created to drive a full ball with power through extra cover
McKay to Pollard, 1 run played off the back foot with an open face to third man
McKay to Russell, 1 run a slower ball and the batsman pulls to early, mis-timing it on the off side when he was trying to hit towards leg
McKay to Pollard, 1 run a yorker this time, the batsman manages to keep it out and run a quick single
McKay to Russell, 1 run full and straight, Russell drives straight past the bowler, David Hussey runs to his right from long-off to cut off the ball

McKay to Pollard, SIX runs Forrest has mis-judged the catch on the backward square leg boundary and conceded six! Pollard flicked the ball off his pads in the air, Forrest moved to his right on the boundary and wasn't sure where the boundary was. In the end the ball went past him and bounced beyond the rope
Doherty to Sammy, FOUR runs full ball outside off, Sammy drives with power this time, finding the gap on the deep cover boundary
Doherty to Sammy, FOUR runs too full on the pads this time, Sammy flicks, and flicks superbly into the gap on the backward square leg boundary
Doherty to Sammy, no run defended back to the bowler
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Doherty to Pollard, 1 run hit flat and hard towards long-off, Warner runs in to try and catch the ball, then decides to stay back and field it, it bounces into his chest
Doherty to Sammy, 1 run driven firmly through the off side for a single
Lee to Sammy, 1 run short ball and Sammy pulls towards deep square leg

Lee to Pollard, SIX runs Pollard gets to his century with a huge hit over the midwicket boundary, backing away to a short delivery and pulling, he takes of his helmet and roars, tremendous intensity in that celebration

Lee to Pollard, OUT he's gone this time, the delivery was fuller outside off and Pollard swung hard at it, slicing it in the air towards deep cover where Hussey ran in and took the catch. Pollard's played a special innings and he gets a warm ovation from this crowd
Lee to Sammy, SIX runs Sammy's pulled a short ball and what's happened there? The ball went high in the air and cleared Forrest on the boundary. He's not having much joy out there
Lee to Sammy, FOUR runs Full ball outside off stump, Sammy stays in his crease and drives hard, drilling the ball past Lee and beating the fielder at mid-off

Lee to Sammy, SIX runs Sammy's ended the innings with what could be the biggest hit of the day! He's sent the length ball flying over the midwicket boundary with an immense swing. West Indies have scored 145 runs off the last 12 overs to finish with 294. Sammy raised his fist as he watched that ball disappear from sight

13.15 A breathless finish to the West Indies innings. They needed some momentum after losing their way in the middle overs and it was provided by Pollard, with supporting acts from Russell and Sammy. A tremendous display of power-hitting towards the end of the innings. Australia will need something equally special to ensure West Indies don't
Watson and Warner to open Australia's chase. Kemar Roach has the new ball.
Roach to Watson, no run the ball lifts from short of a length and angles into Watson, who plays from his crease and gets hit in the stomach
Roach to Watson, 1 run played off the back foot towards third man
Roach to Warner, no run a full ball crashes into Warner's back pad after he misses the flick, Roach appeals but that pitched outside leg
Roach to Warner, no run defended on the back foot towards the bowler
Roach to Warner, 1 run short of a length and straight, played off the back foot on the leg side
Roach to Watson, no run a full delivery outside off stump, Watson tries to steer through point but misses
Bravo to Warner, 1 wide Bravo goes down leg side with his first ball from over the wicket to the left-hander
Bravo to Watson, 1 run Watson strides out and tries to drive through cover, ends up mis-timing it on the leg side
Bravo to Forrest, 1 wide Forrest's first ball is a bouncer but it is too high
Bravo to Forrest, no run good length and straight, Forrest gets behind the line and defends
Bravo to Forrest, no run too full and on the pads, flicked towards square leg
Bravo to Forrest, FOUR runs too full on the pads, Forrest gets going with a crisp flick, placed into the gap on the deep square leg boundary
Bravo to Forrest, no run good length and straight, defended on the leg side
Roach to Watson, no run full and straight, Watson moves forward and drives towards the bowler, Roach raises his hand and deflects the ball towards mid-off
Roach to Watson, no run defended from the crease on the off side
Roach to Watson, 2 runs short of a length outside off, steered off the back foot towards third man
Roach to Watson, 1 run cut off the back foot towards deep point
Roach to Forrest, no run short of a length outside off, lofts of lift for Roach, Forrest lets it go
Roach to Forrest, FOUR runs fuller length and a bit too straight, Forrest clips off his pads and finds the boundary behind square again
Bravo to Watson, no run good length outside off stump, defended on the off side
Bravo to Watson, no run a full ball angling into the right-hander, Watson tries to flick but misses and is hit on the pad, that was missing leg stump
Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs too full and too wide, Watson strides forward and plays a powerful drive through extra cover, he hit it in the air but past the diving fielder
Bravo to Watson, 1 run nudged off the pads towards wide mid-on
Bravo to Forrest, 1 wide short and extremely wide outside off, he's going to have to bowl that again
Bravo to Forrest, 1 run Forrest moves across his crease and flicks the ball through square
Bravo to Watson, SIX runs Watson strides forward to a length ball and hoists it back over the bowler's head with a powerful drive, superb shot, clinically executed
Roach to Forrest, 1 wide short of a length but down leg side, another wide. Australia also had this leg-side wide problem early when they were bowling
Roach to Forrest, no run good length outside off stump, Forrest stays in his crease and tries to defend, he gets beaten
Roach to Forrest, no run short of a length outside off, good carry to the keeper after Forrest shoulders arms
Roach to Forrest, no run good length angling into the right-hander, played from the crease on the leg side
Roach to Forrest, 1 run Forrest jams down on a length ball outside off and gets a bottom edge past his stumps on the leg side, he hit that with the inside toe of the bat
Roach to Watson, no run Watson strides forward and drives but doesn't beat cover
Roach to Watson, SIX runs too short, Watson swivels and dispatches the ball into the stands at midwicket with a powerful pull, he's got this chase started
Bravo to Forrest, 1 run played off the back foot through cover

Bravo to Watson, FOUR runs edged and just wide of the diving Baugh! There's no slip in place. Watson tried to run a good length ball that angled into him towards third man and edged it finer than he would have liked
Bravo to Watson, no run defended on the front foot on the off side

Bravo to Watson, 1 run is that another edge? It was! Watson tried to steer to third man once again and the ball bounced off the outside edge, Baugh dived full length and got some glove on it but could not hold on.
Bravo to Forrest, no run defended on the leg side
Bravo to Forrest, 1 wide Bravo bowls another full ball down leg side
Bravo to Forrest, 1 run short ball and Forrest pulls towards deep square leg
Roach to Forrest, 2 runs short of a length angling into the body, played off the back foot through midwicket
Roach to Forrest, no run short of a length around off stump, defended on the back foot
Roach to Forrest, FOUR runs Forrest stays in his crease, waits for the length ball and drives through the line, placing it perfectly between the bowler and mid-off
Roach to Forrest, no run defended from the crease towards mid-on
Roach to Forrest, no run good length outside off stump, Forrest strides forward and shoulders arms
Roach to Forrest, FOUR runs another outside edge races to the third man boundary. This time along the ground and wide of first slip. Forrest pushed forward to defend but edged it
Narine to Watson, no run Watson moves forward to defend, he gets hit on the pad and the ball lobs up in front of him, Baugh runs forward to catch it, no bat on that though
Narine to Watson, no run Watson tries to defend on the back foot but gets an inside edge on to his pad
Narine to Watson, no run defended on the back foot towards square leg
Narine to Watson, no run Watson strides forward and plays on the leg side
Narine to Watson, 1 run played off the back foot in front of square
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the back foot on the leg side
Sammy to Forrest, no run good length outside off stump, Bailey stays back and plays to point
Sammy to Forrest, 1 run played off the back foot wide of short third man for a single
Sammy to Bailey, no run fuller length around off stump, Forrest pushes on the front foot to mid-off
Sammy to Bailey, FOUR runs short ball, Bailey swivels and swats it into the gap on the deep backward square leg boundary, he was in total control of that shot and timed it well enough to beat Russell
Sammy to Bailey, no run left alone outside off stump
Narine to Forrest, no run defended on the back foot
Narine to Forrest, no run played off the front foot to Pollard at midwicket
Narine to Forrest, no run defended towards Pollard at midwicket again
Narine to Forrest, 1 run pushed off the front foot towards deep midwicket
Narine to Bailey, no run spin from outside off into the right-hander, Bailey defends on the back foot
Narine to Bailey, no run Bailey defends once again, Narine's exceptional economy continues

Sammy to Forrest, OUT Forrest's been caught at third man but the fielder, Johnson Charles seems to have hurt himself. Forrest tried to hook a short of a length ball but ended up top-edging it towards third man, Charles came running in from the boundary and dived forward, taking the catch inches from the ground. Splendid effort. But he
Sammy to Hussey, no run good length and straight, played back to the bowler
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run short of a length on the hips, Hussey moves across and glances behind square
Sammy to Bailey, no run defended on the off side
Sammy to Bailey, 1 run played off the back foot behind point
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run Hussey goes back and taps the ball towards square leg
Narine to Hussey, 1 run Hussey goes back and cuts towards deep backward point
Narine to Bailey, 1 run Bailey moves forward and pushes the ball towards long on
Narine to Hussey, no run Hussey strides forward to defend and gets beaten by one that spins across him

Narine to Hussey, no run Narine appeals for lbw but the umpire says not out. Hussey went back and across to a skiddy ball and tried to play towards square leg. That pitched outside leg. West Indies do not review.
Narine to Hussey, 2 runs driven firmly off the front foot towards deep point
Narine to Hussey, 1 run driven off the front foot towards long off
Sammy to Hussey, no run a length ball which Hussey plays back to the bowler
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run played off the front foot towards wide mid-on
Sammy to Bailey, 1 run Bailey clips the ball off his pads towards deep backward square
Sammy to Hussey, no run Hussey strides forward and drives to cover
Sammy to Hussey, no run length ball outside off, Hussey moves forward and drives to short cover
Sammy to Hussey, no run good length and straight, Hussey gets behind the line and defends solidly
Bravo to Bailey, no run driven off the front foot to mid-off
Bravo to Bailey, no run good length, angling into the right-hander, defended on the off side
Bravo to Bailey, 1 run another full ball angling into Bailey, who leans across and drives to mid-on, there's a mix-up in the calls but they run in the end
Bravo to Hussey, no run played from the crease towards gully, where Sammy dives to his left and fields
Bravo to Hussey, 1 wide Bravo strays down leg side
Bravo to Hussey, no run fuller length outside off stump, Hussey lets it go as the ball slides across him

Bravo to Hussey, FOUR runs terrific shot! Hussey's so good in that region. He had width to cut, because the ball was short and wide, and he placed it between gully and backward point, third man had no chance either
Sammy to Bailey, no run good length and straight, Bailey defends
Sammy to Bailey, no run good length on a wicket to wicket line, Bailey defends towards the bowler
Sammy to Bailey, 1 run short of a length outside off, Bailey steers to third man where Bishoo, who's on the field for Charles, fields
Sammy to Hussey, no run Sammy angles the ball back into the left-hander after slanting it across him, Hussey bottom-edges the cut on to his pad
Sammy to Hussey, no run defended towards point
Sammy to Hussey, no run driven from the crease towards cover
Roach to Bailey, 1 run touch back of a length, spearing in, Bailey hops back and deflects the ball to midwicket
Roach to Hussey, 1 run slanted across the lefty, on a good length, dabbed to third man
Roach to Bailey, 1 wide down the leg side, Bailey can't get anything on it
Roach to Bailey, no run length ball, defended in front of the stumps back down the wicket
Roach to Bailey, no run fuller ball, on the stumps, worked to mid-on
Roach to Bailey, no run back of a length, Bailey goes back and drives to short cover

Roach to Bailey, 1 run full, straight, driven back - and the ball hits the stumps at the non-striker's end. Roach couldn't get a fingertip on it, but they decide against running on the deflection ... then a wild throw from sub fielder Devendra Bishoo at mid-off hands them a single to long leg anyway
Sammy to Bailey, 1 run Good length ball outside off, Bailey pushes forward and opens the face to steer towards third man
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run Good length around middle and off, Hussey pushes off the front foot to mid-off and runs quickly

Sammy to Bailey, SIX runs Bailey moves forward to a length ball and simply hits through the line, a pick-up shot that sends the ball over the wide-long on boundary, didn't look to hit with much power, just timed it
Sammy to Bailey, no run left alone outside off stump
Sammy to Bailey, 1 run Bailey gets an inside edge on to the pad towards square leg
Sammy to Hussey, FOUR runs there's width to cut and Hussey loves it there, cracking it past gully into the gap on the third man boundary
Roach to Bailey, 2 runs short ball and Bailey plays the swivel pull to the deep midwicket boundary
Roach to Bailey, 1 run Dwayne Bravo leaps to his left at extra cover to cut off a firmly-hit drive, saved three runs I think
Roach to Hussey, 1 run Hussey tries to cover drive but mis-times it towards mid-off
Roach to Bailey, 1 run turned off the pads through square leg
Roach to Hussey, FOUR runs too full outside off, Hussey moves forward and uses the width to free his arms, drilling the ball through cover with a powerful drive
Roach to Hussey, 1 run too straight this time, Hussey clips off his pads to square leg
Russell to Hussey, no run length ball on middle and off, Hussey pushes from his crease in front of point
Russell to Hussey, no run fuller length on off, Hussey drives on the front foot towards the fielder at mid-off
Russell to Hussey, 2 runs poor line, on the pads, Hussey glances in front of Bishoo at short fine leg, he scampers after the ball and slides to field it before it reaches the boundary
Russell to Hussey, 1 run once again the line is on the pads, this time Hussey glances towards short fine leg's left, Bishoo dives to cut it off
Russell to Bailey, no run defended on the front foot towards cover
Russell to Bailey, 1 run Hussey strides forward and fluently drives a length ball through cover
Narine to Bailey, no run he hits the pad as Bailey pushes forward to defend, the offbreak hit him outside the line of the stumps
Narine to Bailey, no run defended on the back foot
Narine to Bailey, no run played off the back foot towards square leg
Narine to Bailey, no run Bailey moves forward and defends towards the bowler
Narine to Bailey, no run Bailey stays in his crease and plays the ball with the spin to midwicket
Narine to Bailey, 1 run comes forward this time and drives to long-on to ensure it isn't a maiden over

Russell to Bailey, OUT edged and caught! The ball was ordinary, apart from the extra bounce that caused the edge. Russell pitched short and wide, but Baiey top-edged the cut because it bounced a bit more, Baugh took an easy catch to end what was a promising partnership for Australia
Russell to Hussey, 1 run pushedoff the front foot to get off the mark right away, a single through cover

Russell to Hussey, OUT caught down the leg side and the umpire Brathwaite gives it out after a long thought! Russel pitched short of a length and Hussey tried to pull, the ball was too close to the body and he was cramped for room, he ended up edging it to the keeper. Russel and Baugh appealed confidently and eventually the finger wen
Russell to Wade, no run A short of a length ball gets big on Wade who defends awkwardly
Russell to Wade, no run a short ball and the batsman lets it go
Russell to Wade, no run good length angling across the right-hander, left alone by the batsman
Narine to Hussey, no run nudged off the pads towards square leg
Narine to Hussey, 1 run slightly short from Narine and Hussey pulls to deep square leg
Narine to Wade, no run defended on the front foot towards point
Narine to Wade, no run bowled quicker outside off stump, Wade lets it pass
Narine to Wade, no run defended on the back foot to forward short leg
Narine to Wade, no run Wade moves forward and defends
Russell to Hussey, no run good length close to off stump, Hussey stays in his crease and shoulders arms
Russell to Hussey, no run good length on off stump this time, Hussey has to defend to cover
Russell to Hussey, no run that's a sharp short ball, Hussey bends his knees and lets it pass
Russell to Hussey, 2 runs Charles is back at third man and makes a fine diving save to stop a fierce cut from Hussey
Russell to Hussey, no run good length outside off, Hussey blocks from his crease
Russell to Hussey, 1 run played off the back foot towards cover
Narine to Hussey, no run played off the pads behind square
Narine to Hussey, FOUR runs the quicker ball but it's a bit short outside off, Hussey waits and cuts it past short third man
Narine to Hussey, no run defended on the front foot
Narine to Hussey, 1 run tossed up, Hussey moves forward to take it on the full and whips through midwicket
Narine to Wade, no run defended on the front foot
Narine to Wade, no run quicker ball pushed across the left-hander, Wade tries to cut but is beaten
Russell to Hussey, no run short of a length angling into the right-hander, Hussey jumps back and blocks
Russell to Hussey, no run played towards mid-on, the fielder at midwicket cuts it off
Russell to Hussey, no run a supremely directed bouncer, Hussey has to way a long way to avoid it
Russell to Hussey, FOUR runs that's only a bit short but Hussey moves back quickly to pull the ball into the gap on the deep midwicket boundary
Russell to Hussey, 1 run full delivery angling into the pads, Hussey clips to deep backward square
Russell to Wade, no run Wade tries to cut a good length ball that angles across him and is beaten
Samuels to Hussey, 1 wide slides down leg side with his first ball
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run pulled through square leg for a single
Samuels to Wade, 1 run a bit short and Wade cuts off the back foot through point
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run turned off the pad on the front foot towards square leg
Samuels to Wade, no run cut from the crease towards backward point
Samuels to Wade, no run a full delivery, driven to cover
Samuels to Wade, 1 run cut off the back foot through backward point

Russell to Wade, no run a confident appeal from West Indies after Wade fends at a short of a length delivery that angles across him from over the wicket and is beaten, they thought there might have been an edge, but they do not review the not-out decision
Russell to Wade, no run Wade chases a wide ball outside off and gets beaten while trying to cut
Russell to Wade, no run Wade jumps and tries to fend a superb short ball and nearly gloves it to the keeper, quick, hostile bowling from Russell
Russell to Wade, 1 wide fuller and wide outside off, Wade moves forward and tries to cover drive but can't connect, that's a harsh call from the umpire
Russell to Wade, no run short of a length and straight, Wade short-arm pulls in front of square
Russell to Wade, FOUR runs he's hit this well, pulling a short ball that sits up through midwicket, he hit that from around off stump and connected superbly
Russell to Wade, no run Wade moves forward and chases a fuller and wider ball outside off, he gets beaten on the expansive cover drive
Samuels to Hussey, no run played off the pads through square leg
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run driven to long on for a single
Samuels to Wade, no run defended on the front foot
Samuels to Wade, no run Wade strides forward and blocks
Samuels to Wade, 1 run punched off the back foot through point
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run Hussey moves back and plays the ball towards long-on
Sammy to Hussey, no run short of a length and straight, Hussey defends
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run steered off the back foot through point for a single
Sammy to Wade, no run good length and straight, defended back to the bowler
Sammy to Wade, no run played back towards Sammy once again
Sammy to Wade, FOUR runs full with width outside off, Wade lays into it and cover drives with power to the boundary
Sammy to Wade, 1 run Pollard's dropped a catch at backward point! Wade moved forward and played the square drive, slicing it in the air and straight to Pollard, that was an absolute sitter
Samuels to Wade, no run defended on the front foot
Samuels to Wade, 1 leg bye swept down on one knee behind square
Samuels to Hussey, FOUR runs short ball and Hussey pulls into the gap on the deep square leg boundary
Samuels to Hussey, FOUR runs this time he uses the pace and width outside off to steer the ball to the third man boundary
Samuels to Hussey, no run played off the pads behind square
Samuels to Hussey, 1 run driven to long-on for a single
Sammy to Hussey, no run short of a length outside off, Hussey tries to cut and is beaten
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run played towards midwicket
Sammy to Wade, 1 run Wade stands in his crease and cuts the length ball from outside off towards deep point
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run Hussey cuts from close to off stump towards third man
Sammy to Wade, no run full ball angling across the left-hander, driven to cover
Sammy to Wade, no run Wade jumps up and tries to swat a ball through the off side but he mis-times it
Pollard to Hussey, no run length, outside off and dabbed to point
Pollard to Hussey, FOUR runs wide of the crease, short ball, looping in towards Hussey - it's nowhere near quick enough and the batsman muscles it in front of deep midwicket
Pollard to Hussey, FOUR runs another long-hop, which Hussey pulls through square leg this time. Pollard's dobblers are being given the treatment
Pollard to Hussey, no run length, wide of off, cut in front of point but a diving stop prevents a single
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run on the stumps, pushed into the gap at short midwicket
Pollard to Wade, no run length, rolls his fingers over the ball and Wade pushes into the off side
Sammy to Hussey, no run length ball, strikes Hussey on the pads but Sammy's muted appeal is turned down
Sammy to Hussey, no run drops a tad shorter, pushed towards cover
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run wide of off stump and driven through a gap at cover
Sammy to Wade, 1 run angled into the right hander, worked into the on side
Sammy to Hussey, 2 runs pitched up a bit more and Hussey drives to the cover sweeper
Sammy to Hussey, 1 run full delivery, outside off, chipped over the infield through cover
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run length, outside off, guided down to third man
Pollard to Wade, 1 run back of a length, on the legs and Wade dribbles it round the corner
Pollard to Hussey, no run bangs it in, towards the body, Hussey hops back and gets a leading edge that pops short on to the wicket
Pollard to Hussey, FOUR runs short and wide, Hussey needs no invitation to slap a cut shot dismissively behind point
Pollard to Hussey, 1 run room outside off and Hussey steers the ball behind point - that brings up a doughty fifty

Pollard to Wade, OUT gone! Wade slogs high into the St Lucia sky and is caught at long-off! It was a pitched up delivery, outside off but Wade could only get underneath it. After his contribution with the bat, Pollard has secured a key breakthrough with his loping medium pace. This will be known as Pollard's ODI in years to come
Sammy to Lee, no run length, outside off and cut to point
Sammy to Lee, 1 run slightly shorter, Lee guides it down to third man

Sammy to Hussey, (no ball) 1 run gone! Or is he? Hussey slogged to deep midwicket - but it had been called a no-ball! There were too many fielders in the ring, apparently Hussey uncharacteristically let rip at a short ball, scooping it into the deep, where a diving catch was well-taken
Sammy to Lee, no run length, Lee misses with a prod outside off
Sammy to Lee, no run driven to cover
Sammy to Lee, no run outside off, pushed towards cover again
Sammy to Lee, 1 run squeezed out square - good diving stop at point but the throw concedes a misfield
Narine to Lee, no run tossed up, Lee smothers it outside off
Narine to Lee, FOUR runs on the stumps, blocked
Narine to Lee, no run room outside off and Lee steers it past the slip for a four to third man
Narine to Lee, no run flighted, on the stumps, Lee defends
Narine to Lee, no run quicker delivery, Lee edges on to his pads in front of leg stump
Narine to Lee, no run on the stumps, towards leg, Lee misses and ball hits him on the pad
Roach to Hussey, 1 run full-length delivery, punched down the ground to long-on
Roach to Lee, no run length ball, Lee defends on the back foot in front of the stumps
Roach to Lee, no run shorter delivery, Lee knocks it towards point
Roach to Lee, 1 run back of a length, fired in a Lee's body, he takes his bottom hand of the bat as he jabs it into the leg side
Roach to Hussey, 1 run pitched up and Hussey steps out, drives to long-on
Roach to Lee, no run length, on the pads and flicked round the corner to short leg
Narine to Hussey, no run length ball, on the stumps and spinning to leg, Hussey nudges on the back foot to short leg
Narine to Hussey, 1 run tossed up and struck hard to midwicket ... Samuels makes the stop but can't prevent the batsmen stealing a run
Narine to Lee, no run tossed up on the stumps, blocked
Narine to Lee, no run flatter, outside off, Lee leans out and prods square
Narine to Lee, no run leg-stump line, the ball cannons out square off the pad
Narine to Lee, no run
Roach to Hussey, no run bouncer, well-directed and following Hussey as he swayed back in his crease
Roach to Hussey, 3 runs pitched up and driven in the air over mid-off - not a clean connection and its collected before the boundary

Roach to Lee, (no ball) ouch! Roach bowls a beamer that strikes Lee flush on the glove. It's a no-ball and Roach goes down the wicket to apologise ... Lee jerked away from that like he'd been scalded. He dropped his bat as the ball struck his left hand, then dropped to his knees. He initially walked away from Roach, as if to compose
Roach to Lee, 1 run and Roach follows it up with a short ball that Lee keeps away from his ribs by nudging into the leg side. All's fair in cricket and war
Roach to McKay, no run first ball to McKay is back of a length, and defended on the back foot
Roach to McKay, no run a quick bouncer, which the batsman steps away from
Narine to Lee, no run tossed up on the stumps, defended
Narine to Lee, 1 run outside off, driven past cover by Lee
Narine to McKay, no run flighted in, McKay pushes forward outside off and is hit on the pad - but he was outside off stump
Narine to McKay, no run again tossed up outside off and spinning back into the pad, this one might have been going down leg
Narine to McKay, no run slightly quicker, edged on to his pads
Narine to McKay, no run full, outside off, driven to the close fielder
Roach to Lee, FOUR runs full, quick and Lee inside-edges to the fine leg rope for four
Roach to Lee, FOUR runs shot! pitched up again and Lee steps back to blammo a four through extra-cover
Roach to Lee, FOUR runs three in a row! Roach is striving for the yorker but it's not quite full enough and Lee spears it through cover. He's taking out his frustrations from Roach's last over
Roach to Lee, SIX runs this time his picks up the ball and deposits it back over long-on! That was a ferocious hit, a huge windmilling swing of the arms and the ball flies over the boundary
Roach to Lee, no run Roach hits back with a bouncer and Lee is forced to curtail his aggression
Roach to Lee, SIX runs he connects again with another almighty thrash, flat-batting a six over deep midwicket. Lee the gunslinger is going to go down in a blaze! That's 24 off the over!
Bravo to McKay, 1 run length, on the stumps and McKay fiddles it into the leg side
Bravo to Lee, no run pitched up wide of the stumps and Lee can't get his flashing blade under this one, squirting the ball out towards point
Bravo to Lee, no run line and length, Lee gets behind this one
Bravo to Lee, no run length, outside off and Lee swings so hard he almost comes off his feet - but the ball flies straight to cover

Bravo to Lee, SIX runs Lee smokes another massive six, into the stands over extra-cover! Bravo pitched it up into the slot and the batsman rocked back and creamed it into the crowd. Lee is batting incredibly here ...
Bravo to Lee, no run Lee backs away again and Bravo slings it wide of off, the batsman unable to connect
Russell to McKay, 1 run back of a length and McKay loops it to square leg
Russell to Lee, no run full, slower, out the back of the hand and Lee is forced to jam down on it
Russell to Lee, no run full-speed yorker this time, following Lee down the leg side, cramping him for space and he can't make a proper connection with the bat
Russell to Lee, 1 run rolls his fingers over the ball, Lee smites it from outside off stump over cover for a couple
Russell to McKay, no run full and slightly wide, driven with a flourish but straight to cover
Russell to McKay, no run length ball, pushed on the back foot to short third man - a good over form Russell, just putting the lid on Lee's fiery retribution
Bravo to Lee, FOUR runs full, on the legs and swiped down to the rope at fine leg. Lee's just a couple more slogs from fifty ...
Bravo to Lee, 1 run on the stumps, swings the arms and clips a length ball through square leg
Bravo to McKay, no run well-directed bouncer, beating an enthusiastic swish
Bravo to Lee, 1 run back of a length, dropped short on the leg side and they dash through for one
Bravo to Doherty, no run over the wicket, length ball angled into the left-handed Doherty - he gets solidly behind it and defends
Russell to Lee, no run bouncer, directed at the batsman, who swings and misses
Russell to Lee, SIX runs smashed down the ground and Lee goes to fifty with a six! Another piece of clean hitting that would make Kieron Pollard proud!
Russell to Lee, SIX runs another one goes the distance! This time straight down the ground, rather than over long-on. Holy Moly
Russell to Lee, 1 run pitched right up and Lee manages to keep the ball out and scramble one to mid-on
Russell to Doherty, no run length, outside off and Doherty plays and misses
Russell to Doherty, 1 run on the stumps and flicked to short fine leg
Narine to Doherty, no run flighted on the stumps, Doherty nibbles it back to the bowler
Narine to Doherty, no run tossed up, on leg stump, spinning across and beats the outside edge
Narine to Hilfenhaus, no run middle and leg doosra, Hilfenhaus defends in front of his stumps
Narine to Hilfenhaus, no run given some air outside off, spinning back inside the bat as Hilfenhaus goes to leave
Narine to Hilfenhaus, 1 wide dragged down the leg side
Narine to Hilfenhaus, no run on the stumps, spinning across into the pad but sliding down leg
Roach to Lee, no run back of a length, Lee swings and gets a bottom edge that flies to short leg
Roach to Lee, no run another bouncer, swinging across the batsman, who misses with a flailing bat
Roach to Lee, 1 wide more chin music - though it goes some way above Lee's head, let alone his chin. That's called wide

Roach to Lee, OUT gives it the old heave-ho again but this time Lee can't clear long-off. That's it, West Indies have won! Roach removes Lee by legitimate means - though he probably regrets winding him up in the first place. A heroic innings from Lee, his best score in ODIs, but the task proved beyond him and his team-mates
And with that, we'll be signing off. Thanks for your comments and have a good morning/afternoon/night. Join us for the fifth and final ODI on Sunday ... Cheerio!
West Indies won by 42 runs
Player of the match is Kieron Pollard, WI
